body: In order to format the output, just put 3 backticks before and after. Also, as it is very long it would appreciated if you could save it into a file and attatch the file rather than pasting all of it, you may actually just past the salient part.
Hey @DLWCMD, for Horovod, the issue appears to be that you don't have `libuv` or `openmpi` installed.  Try running `brew install libuv` and let us know how it goes.
In general, for installing Horovod please follow the steps here: https://github.com/horovod/horovod#install
Thanks very much for the guidance.
@ DLWCMD so where you able to solve the issue following the guidance? Can we close this issue?

Piero,

 

Thanks for the follow-up, and the short answer is no. One of the many problems is that, on installation, wheel creation fails in several cases. Frankly, this situation is beyond my ability to rectify.

 

However, for me, this problem is indirect: I am not interested in the environments horovod supports, but it seems a requirement when I attempt to install Ludwig[test]. Thus, I assume that the test features will not be available to me. Is this true?

 

Thanks again. I was very impressed with the responsiveness of you and your colleagues to my issue, and I am looking forward to continuing to explore Ludwig.

 

David L. Wilt

3272 Bayou Road

Longboat Key FL 34228

dwilt1947@gmail.com

540-420-0844

 

 

From: Piero Molino <notifications@github.com>

Cc: DLWCMD <dwilt1947@gmail.com>, Mention <mention@noreply.github.com>
Subject: Re: [uber/ludwig] Cannot Install [test] Dependencies (#961)

 

@ DLWCMD so where you able to solve the issue following the guidance? Can we close this issue?

You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or unsubscribe.

Hey @DLWCMD, Horovod is only needed for testing Horovod itself.  If you don't wish to test the Horovod related tests, you can remove it from `requirements_horovod.txt` in your local environment.  Just be aware that some unit tests (those that test Horovod functionality) will fail.
Closing this for now, let us know if you have further problems.

Thanks. I appreciate your support, and I can make good use of Ludwig without horovod.

I realize horovod may not find much traction in mac world. However, I would encourage you to test installation on MacOS/Catalina as time permits, based on my experience.

Thanks again. Keep up the good work with Ludwig, and I look forward to further exploring your tool.

Hey @DLWCMD, we do run Horovod integration in macOS, but due to the nature of having to compile native code at install time, any number of things can go wrong.  If at some point you'd like to dig into this issue, feel free to open an issue on the Horovod GitHub and I'll take a look.

Travis,
Thanks very much, and that is very gracious offer. I understand you have a lot on your plate crafting this new product, and your responsiveness has been outstanding.
I am particularly interested in time series, and one of your examples suggest Ludwig’s support is evolving. I may have something to contribute. Would such content be of interest?

Absolutely!  It would be great to hear more about what you have in mind.

Feel free to open an issue describing what you would like to implement, that could serve as good starting point for future conversation.

Will do. I have a method that allows for easy configuration and random generation of ‘synthetic’ time series, which are very useful to comparing different encodings and hyperparameter testing. I will add details in an issue.

 

Talk soon and take care.

 

David L. Wilt

3272 Bayou Road

Longboat Key FL 34228

dwilt1947@gmail.com

540-420-0844
